intro: Rourea sprucei, commonly known as the Spruce's rourea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
